reviews.review: Really boring, feel asleep for a  lot of it.
The best movie of the world!!!!!!!
An amazing score coupled with great action and funny scenes, but is held back by unexplained atributes

Really really bad...and I'm not just a new comer to marvel, I have the whole encyclopedia of marvel hero's and events that ever happened in their universe....but my oh my this was bad. So many plot holes and so many missed opportunities, while there is good scenes, their usually ruined by thanos as he rewinds time and straight up ruins it. Thanos is way over power and the children of thanos was so point less....because him alone could have wiped out the whole cast. Anyways just a big missed opportunity for such and important time in the universe

Avengers Infinity War is a MARVELous addition to the MCU, and brings together an incredible story. The problem is that they try to squish too many things together and you donâ€™t have much time to focus on just one character.

Worthless cameo heavy movie. Story line jumps around between plot and characters like a pinball machine on steroids. Villains' sinister motivation is an aversion to overpoplulation? Really? Seriously? Who came up with that? Don't waste your time/money

Not the worst thing out of the MCU, but it definitely falls into the bottom portion.  Left the theater feeling extremely underwhelmed, cold, and empty inside from having visually witnessed a 2.5 hour long trailer for Avengers 4.  Just as Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice was an introduction to Justice League and failed as its own movie, Infinity War was nothing more than a convoluted build-up towards Avengers 4.
The movie I waited ten years for.  I got exactly what I wanted. Shock, awe, pain & Joy

I thought the Russo brothers did an incredible job juggling the stories of so many characters, while managing to tell a very compelling story for anyone semi-invested in the MCU. Every character got substantial screen-time and the vast majority of scenes were geared towards meaningful storytelling.
